premise: A person is sleeping at an airport with a hat on their head.
hypothesis: A person sleeps at the airport with a hat on their head.
explanation_1: Sleeping at an airport is a rephrasing of sleeps at the airport.

premise: Two women watching over a herd of goats in a rural setting.
hypothesis: two people oversee a group of animals outside.
explanation_1: A herd of goats is a kind of group of animals.

premise: Three men sit on a ledge in front of a wall, one of them is smoking a cigarette.
hypothesis: Three men sit on a wall's ledge while one smokes.
explanation_1: The men are sitting on a wall's ledge, and it states one is smoking.

premise: A boy picking leaves out of a puddle.
hypothesis: The boy is outside.
explanation_1: The boy is playing in a puddle so he must be outside.

premise: A Father and son playing with a wooden train set on a city carpet.
hypothesis: A father plays with a wooden trainset on a city carpet along with his son.
explanation_1: If someone plays you can say they are playing

premise: A man blends fruit at a juice stand in a strip mall.
hypothesis: A man is blending something.
explanation_1: The fruit can be the something blended at a juice stand.

premise: A boy does a cartwheel on a rock cliff.
hypothesis: The boy is flying off a rock cliff.
explanation_1: The boy does a cartwheel and is flying off a rock cliff.

premise: A dog and his owner at a rocky beach.
hypothesis: A dog and his owner are outside
explanation_1: If you are at a rocky beach you are outside.

premise: Two boys in blue shirts fighting behind a gray car and two other children.
hypothesis: the boys are brothers
explanation_1: Boys fight that aren't brothers.

premise: Three children and playing and laughing on the floor.
hypothesis: Children are telling jokes to each other.
explanation_1: The fact that the children are laughing doesn't imply that they are telling jokes, they could be laughing for another reason.

premise: four children lay on a tube.
hypothesis: The tube is from a large truck.
explanation_1: just because children lay on tube doesn't mean that the tube is from a large truck.

premise: A little girl wearing green pants holding something while standing next to a mini hay bale.
hypothesis: A girl stands next to a yellow hay bail.
explanation_1: The girl may not be little and the hay bale could be another color.

premise: Two older gentlemen are waiting to cross a street.
hypothesis: THe men are crossing the street home.
explanation_1: Just because the gentlemen are waiting to cross the street does not mean they are heading home. They could be going anywhere.

premise: A woman with luggage walks along a street in front of a large advertisement.
hypothesis: a woman walking on the street headed on vacation
explanation_1: The woman with luggage may not be specifically headed on a vacation.

premise: A little girl has dunked her head in a bowl of water.
hypothesis: A little girl is getting bullied by her brother.
explanation_1: The girl may not necessarily be getting bullied. He may be trying to play with her.

premise: A man and woman seated at a table together.
hypothesis: The man and woman are on a date.
explanation_1: A man and woman seated at a table together doesn't mean they are on a date.

premise: A beach is full of many people.
hypothesis: the beach is empty
explanation_1: full and empty are contradictions

premise: Young girl carrying camping gear and a stuffed brown dog.
hypothesis: The young boy carries a backpack and a stuffed bear.
explanation_1: There is boy and girl

premise: A male practices BMX bike riding at and man made urban practice field with big lumps of dirt, water and a factory as a back drop.
hypothesis: A man is riding a Segway through the woods.
explanation_1: A bike is not a Segway. The woods are not an urban field.

premise: A boy is jumping over shallow water near some large rocks.
hypothesis: The boy is swimming.
explanation_1: Shallow water near some large rocks prevent from swimming.

premise: Two girls are fighting for the ball in indoor field hockey.
hypothesis: Two girls are sleeping in the indoor field.
explanation_1: The girls cannot be asleep and fighting for the ball.

premise: A young boy, wearing suspenders and a red flannel shirt, hits a piece of metal on an anvil.
hypothesis: A young man role plays a character in Skyrim.
explanation_1: If he hits a piece of metal, he is not role playing.

premise: Two people holding on to each other in front of a mirror.
hypothesis: A man is standing next to a mirror.
explanation_1: There are either two people, or one man.

premise: A shirtless teenager bounces on a trampoline as other children watch.
hypothesis: A shirtless teenager and the children are on a swing set.
explanation_1: One can be either on a trampoline or on a swing set. They can watch it while they are on it simultaneously.
